intro: Denhamia xanthosperma, commonly known as the golden-seeded denhamia, is a flowering plant native to northern Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalypts and other aromatic species. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Its seeds are encased in a hard, yellowish shell, giving it its common name. It is often found in sandy soils and is adapted to the arid and semi-arid environments of its native range.
